The quiz directions are to match each quotation on the first list with one of the names on the second list, matching each name to exactly one quotation.(a) Consider just the first two quotations. If Jacob randomly guesses two different names from the list of five names for the first two quotations, what is the probability that he correctly matches both?

Now consider all five quotations and suppose that Jacob randomly guesses the matching name for each quotation, matching each name to exactly one quotation. Let the random variable <math alttext="uppercase X" overflow="scroll"><mi>X</mi></math> represent the number of correct matches out of the five quotations.
